TEXT: The applicant , ORG , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE in GPE . He is represented before the Court by Mr B. Gelzer , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant worked in GPE as a real property administrator in the C. company . In DATE he was given notice as he had allegedly appropriated payments for repairs which had not been undertaken .

Criminal proceedings were instituted against the applicant on account of professional fraud . Upon appeal , ORG ( ORG ) of the GPE of GPE - Stadt on DATE sentenced the applicant to CARDINAL GPE imprisonment . The court was composed of CARDINAL judges and assisted by court registrar PERSON

Meanwhile , in DATE the applicant brought an action before ORG against the C. company , claiming MONEY ( CHF ) , inter alia , for outstanding salary claims . In DATE the defendant company brought a counter - action against the applicant , claiming CHF CARDINAL . Proceedings were then continued before ORG ( Zivilgericht ) of the GPE of GPE - Stadt which on DATE suspended the proceedings in view of the criminal proceedings instituted against the applicant .
Proceedings were resumed in DATE . The defendant company brought a further counter - action against the applicant , now claiming CHF MONEY for damages caused by fictitious bills .
As from DATE , judge NORP , the President of ORG , acted in the applicant ’s case as the judge responsible for the preparation of cases for trial ( PERSON ) .
On DATE the applicant extended his claims to CHF CARDINAL . He also requested free legal aid .

On DATE judge NORP authorised the amendments of the action and counter - action . In order to examine the applicant ’s request for free legal aid , he obtained copies of judgments from the competent courts which had conducted the criminal proceedings and had refused the applicant free legal aid . On DATE judge NORP refused the applicant ’s request for legal aid as he had not demonstrated his indigence .

On DATE judge NORP fixed CARDINAL DATE as the time - limit for filing replies to the action and counter - action . On DATE the defendant company filed further submissions , accompanied by photocopies of certain documents . As the applicant contested their authenticity , judge NORP requested the defendant company to submit the original documents .

On DATE the applicant amended his action and requested , in addition , CHF MONEY from the defendant company . As a result , judge NORP instructed the applicant to pay advance costs of CHF CARDINAL . The applicant replied that he was unable to pay this sum whereupon judge NORP declared the amendment to the action inadmissible ( aus dem ORG gewiesen ) .
On DATE both the applicant and the defendant company filed further submissions .
On DATE judge NORP closed the exchange of statements and ordered the documents of the criminal proceedings to be included in the case - file .

On DATE judge NORP terminated his functions at ORG and became a judge at ORG of the GPE of ORG . Thereafter , judge PERSON undertook the functions in the applicant ’s case before ORG as judge responsible for the preparation of cases for trial .

On DATE a hearing took place before ORG at which both parties were present . In its judgment of CARDINAL DATE the court ordered the applicant to pay CHF MONEY to the defendant company , while formally taking note that the latter accepted the applicant ’s action to the extent of CHF MONEY . It imposed the costs of the court proceedings concerning the action , amounting to CHF CARDINAL , on the applicant , who was furthermore ordered to pay PERCENT of the costs of the counter - action , amounting altogether to CHF MONEY .

The applicant appealed against the judgment in respect of the imposition of costs , claiming that the defendant company should pay the entire costs of the counter - action , and PERCENT of the costs of his action . On DATE ORG of the GPE of ORG dismissed the appeal . It transpires from the judgment that the bench was composed of CARDINAL judges , among them judge NORP , as well as the court registrar PERSON

The applicant ’s public law appeal ( staatsrechtliche Beschwerde ) was dismissed by ORG on DATE . Insofar as the applicant complained of the lack of impartiality of judge NORP and court registrar PERSON , ORG stated :

“ According to the submissions of ORG ... NORP had acted , in the case at issue , as judge responsible for preparing cases for trial DATE and DATE . During this period of time he examined the applicant ’s requests for free legal aid ; imposed advance court costs ; dealt with requests concerning amendments of the action and the counter - action ; fixed time - limits for the exchange of statements ; and decided on requests for the transmittal of files , including those of the criminal proceedings . On DATE , when a new judge took over these functions , the preparation of the case for trial was not yet completed . In particular , the successor had to decide on the taking of evidence requested ; to prepare the trial ; and to participate in the decision . As a result , while NORP , as the first instance judge responsible for the proceedings , took all decisions necessary for the progress of the proceedings and for the preparation of the judgment , at no moment was he obliged to express himself on the admissibility or the merits of the legal requests stated in the action or the counter - action ...

The participation of NORP also does not raise an issue under ... LAW . It has not been made clear why the procedure in second instance – despite the participation of DATE could no longer be described as open and undetermined in respect of the legal questions to be resolved , a fortiori as the judgment of the lower court was only contested in respect of the costs . When acting as judge responsible for preparing cases for trial , NORP did not have to deal with the issue of attributing the costs of the proceedings . He therefore appears as an impartial judge in this respect . This conclusion is not altered by the fact that NORP obtained knowledge of certain aspects playing a rôle in respect of the question whether or not the defendant company had instituted proceedings in good faith . ...

The complaint of a breach of LAW and the LAW is equally unfounded insofar as court registrar PERSON collaborated in the second instance criminal and civil proceedings . In view of the criteria previously referred to , no partiality can objectively be made out if a court registrar participates in the decision - making in CARDINAL proceedings with different contentious objects . It plays no part here that in both proceedings similar partial questions – albeit from a completely different vantage point - may have arisen . ”
